definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: The tolerance he that old daddy take into to my bug munificence have gets the man sort.
sentences.chinese: 老爸對我的錯誤加以寬容，他有着男人般的寬宏大量。

sentences.english: In her strongest , most magnanimous moments.
sentences.chinese: 在她最堅強，最寬宏大量的時候。

sentences.english: Both kindness and munificence are due to his nature.
sentences.chinese: 他天生既仁慈又寬宏大量。

sentences.english: He accepted the apology with great generosity.
sentences.chinese: 他寬宏大量地接受了道歉。

sentences.english: The bounteous largess given thee to give?
sentences.chinese: 她慷慨，只賃給寬宏大量的人。
貝佐斯對喬布斯十分寬宏大量。

sentences.english: Of course, a victor can always be magnanimous.
sentences.chinese: 當然，一個勝者常常是寬宏大量的。

sentences.english: His charity bespeaks a generous nature.
sentences.chinese: 他的施捨行爲表現出他的寬宏大量的性格。

sentences.english: He displayed extraordinary magnanimity toward his enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他對他的敵人展現異常的寬宏大量。

sentences.english: A wise ruler is generous in victory.
sentences.chinese: 賢明的統治者在勝利時能寬宏大量。

sentences.english: I have been generous to a fault, and I have allowed the perception that I am weak and vacillating in my decisions.
sentences.chinese: 我一直寬宏大量，並且讓人們認爲我軟弱和優柔寡斷。

sentences.english: He often mete out generous treatment to those he defeated.
sentences.chinese: 對手下敗將他通常很寬宏大量。

sentences.english: Mr. Liang is a generous man.
sentences.chinese: 梁先生是位寬宏大量的人。

sentences.english: Most of his professors were lenient and helped him along.
sentences.chinese: 他的教授大都對他寬宏大量，始終助他一臂之力。

definition: to start rumours and create trouble
(idiom) to lose one's head/to panic/to go to pieces
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
true sentiments are seen in hard times (idiom)/you see who your true friends are when you go through tough times together/you see who your true friends are when you are in difficulties
to take the big picture into consideration (idiom)/to work for the benefits of all
